gurmukhi: ਤੇ ਭੀ ਬਸਿ ਮਮਤਾ ਹੁੲਿ ਗੲੇ || ਪਰਮੇਸਰ ਪਾਹਨ ਠਹਿਰੲੇ ||੧੩||
transliteration: Te Bhoo Bas(i) Mamtaa Hue Gad|| Parmesar Paahan Thaihrae||13||
translation: They also were overpowered by ‘mineness’ and exhibited the Lord in statues.13.

gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਹਰਿ ਸਿੱਧ ਸਾਧ ਠਹਿਰਾੲੇ || ਤਿਨ ਭੀ ਪਰਮ ਪੁਰਖ ਨਹੀ ਪਾੲੇ ||
transliteration: Tab Har(i) Siddh Saadh Thaihraae|| Tin Bhoo Param Purakh Nahoo Paae||
translation: Then I created Siddhas and sadhs, who also could not realize the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਜੇ ਕੋੲੀ ਹੋਤ ਭਯੋ ਜਗਿ ਸਿਅਾਨਾ || ਤਿਨ ਤਿਨ ਅਪਨੋ ਪੰਥੁ ਚਲਾਨਾ ||੧੪||
transliteration: Je Ko( i)  Hot Bhayo Jag(i) Siaanaa|| Tin Tin Apno Panth(u) Chalaanaa||14||
translation: On whomsoever wisdom dawned, he started his own path. 14.

gurmukhi: ਪਰਮ ਪੁਰਖ ਕਿਨਹੂੰ ਨਹ ਪਾਯੋ || ਬੈਰ ਬਾਦ ਅਹੰਕਾਰ ਬਢਾਯੋ ||
transliteration: Param Purakh Kinhoon Nah Paayo|| Bairbaad Ahankaar Badhaayo||
translation: None could realise the Supreme Lord, but instead spread strife, enmity and ego.

gurmukhi: ਪੇਡ ਪਾਤ ਅਾਪਨ ਤੇ ਜਲੈ || ਪ੍ਰਭ ਕੈ ਪੰਥ ਨ ਕੋੳੂ ਚਲੈ ||੧੫||
transliteration: Ped Paat Aapan Te Jalai|| Prabh Kai Panth Na Ko( i)  Chalai||15||
translation: The tree and the leaves began to burn, because of the inner fire.None followed the path of the Lord.15.

gurmukhi: ਜਿਨਿ ਜਿਨਿ ਤਨਿਕ ਸਿੱਧ ਕੋ ਪਾਯੋ || ਤਿਨ ਤਿਨ ਅਪਨਾ ਰਾਹੁ ਚਲਾਯੋ ||
transliteration: Jin(i) Jin(i) Tanik Siddh Ko Paayo|| Tin Tin Apnaa Raah(u) Chalaayo||
translation: Whosoever attained a little spiritual power, he started his own ptah.

gurmukhi: ਪਰਮੇਸਰ ਨ ਕਿਨਹੂੰ ਪਹਿਚਾਨਾ || ਮਮ ੳੁਚਾਰਤੇ ਭਯੋ ਦਿਵਾਨਾ ||੧੬||
transliteration: Parmesar Na Kinhoon Paihchaanaa|| Mam Ouchaarte Bhayo Divaanaa||16||
translation: None could comprehend the Lord, but instead became mad with ‘I-ness’.16.

gurmukhi: ਪਰਮ ਤੱਤ ਕਿਨਹੂੰ ਨ ਪਛਾਨਾ || ਅਾਪ ਅਾਪ ਭੀਤਰਿ ੳੁਰਝਾਨਾ ||
transliteration: Param Tatt Kinhoon Na Pachhaadaa|| Aap Aap Bhootar(i) Urjhaanaa||
translation: Nobody recognized the Supreme Essence, but was entangled within himself.

gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਜੇ ਜੇ ਰਿਖਰਾਜ ਬਨਾੲੇ || ਤਿਨ ਅਾਪਨ ਪੁਨ ਸਿੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਚਲਾੲੇ ||੧੭||
transliteration: Tab Je Je Rikhraaj Bahaae|| Tin Aapan Poun Sinmrit Chadhaae||17||
translation: All the great rishis (sages), who were then created, produced their own Smritis.17.

gurmukhi: ਜੇ ਸਿੰਮ੍ਰਿਤਨ ਕੇ ਭੲੇ ਅਨੁਰਾਗੀ || ਤਿਨਿ ਤਿਨਿ ਕ੍ਰਿਅਾ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਕੀ ਤਿਅਾਗੀ ||
transliteration: Je Sinmritan Ke Bhae Anuraagoo|| Tin(i) Tin(i) Kriaa Brahm Koo Tiaagoo||
translation: All those who became followers of these smritis, they abandoned the path of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਜਿਨ ਮਨ ਹਰਿ ਚਰਨਨ ਠਹਿਰਾਯੋ || ਸੋ ਸਿੰਮ੍ਰਿਤਨ ਕੇ ਰਾਹ ਨ ਅਾਯੋ ||੧੮||
transliteration: Jin Man Har(i) Charnan Thihraayo|| So Sinmritan Ke Raah Na Aayo||18||
translation: Those who devoted themselves to the Feet of the Lord, they did not adopt the path of the Smritis.18.

gurmukhi: ਬ੍ਹਮਾ ਚਾਰ ਹੀ ਬੇਦ ਬਨਾੲੇ || ਸਰਬ ਲੋਕ ਤਿਹ ਕਰਮ ਚਲਾੲੇ ||
transliteration: Brahmaa Chaar Hoo Bed Banaae|| Sarab Lok Tih Karam Chadhaae||
translation: Brahma composed all the four Vedas, all the people followed the injunctions contained in them.

gurmukhi: ਜਿਨ ਕੀ ਲਿਵ ਹਰਿ ਚਰਨਨ ਲਾਗੀ || ਤੇ ਬੇਦਨ ਤੇ ਭੲੇ ਤਿਅਾਗੀ ||੧੯||
transliteration: Jin Koo Liv Har(i) Charnan Laagoo|| Te Bedan Te Bhae Tiaagoo||19||
translation: Those who were devoted to the Feet of the Lord, they abandoned the Vedas.19.

gurmukhi: ਜਿਨ ਮਤ ਬੇਦ ਕਤੇਬਨ ਤਿਅਾਗੀ || ਪਾਰਬ੍ਹਮ ਕੇ ਭੲੇ ਅਨੁਰਾਗੀ ||
transliteration: Jin Mat Bed Kateban Tiaagoo|| Paarbrahm Ke Bhae Anuraagoo||
translation: Those who abandoned the path of the Vedas and Katebs, they became the devotees of the Lord.
